excerpts: We were surprised at how much BBQ pork we received as an appetizer!
The serving sizes were very generous.
The quality of the pork was very good.
Our server dropped off hot mustard to go with the BBQ pork.
Not to forget--- the pot stickers were good too.
bbq pork.author: Thomas D.
bbq pork.review:
The jasmine tea was flavorful.
(Yeah--tea is served here!  A lot of SF Chinese restaurants have stopped serving tea as soon as you sit down.)

 We were surprised at how much BBQ pork we received as an appetizer!
The serving sizes were very generous.  The quality of the pork was very good.  Our server dropped off hot mustard to go with the BBQ pork.
Not to forget--- the pot stickers were good too.  Crispy and moist at the same time--nice.

Our favorite were the pan fried Hong Kong crispy noodles.  We asked for a combo and it came with seafood, chicken, pork and beef.
It was excellent.  I love it when some of the noodles remain crisp while others are completely saturated with a tasty sauce.

The chicken with black bean sauce and white rice was excellent as well.  I originally ordered chicken and broccoli but they misunderstood and brought me this dish instead.  We decided to keep it because it was amazing.  So glad we kept it.  (They offered to replace it.)

Again, the serving sizes were large!  Service was great.  It's a hop, skip and a jump from the West Portal Muni station.

Clap! Clap! Clap!

excerpts: We ordered BBQ Pork wonton soup.
It was very good.
We also ordered the BBQ Pork Chow Mein.
By this time, I was so full that I only had very, very little of it at the end.
I only added a small dash of soy sauce.
bbq pork.author: Gigi F.
bbq pork.review:
Had dinner here tonight with the fam. Had not eaten here in many years. I wanted my BF and  our daughter to experience this place.

We ordered BBQ Pork wonton soup. It was very good. It tasted the same as I remembered it from all those years ago. 

We also had the Fried Crab Cheese Rangoon. It was good. But, they used to stuff it with a lot more filling before and it was a little more flavorful before as well.  

We ordered Sauteed String Beans. This dish was absolute perfection. Great texture, not overcooked. So tasty. It was my favorite dish of the night. You must try it.  Yumm-O!

We also ordered the BBQ Pork Chow Mein. By this time, I was so full that I only had very, very little of it at the end. I only added a small dash of soy sauce. Even with very little warmth left, it tasted fine.

They brought us very fresh (albeit cold) slices of orange at the end of our meal along with fortune cookies.

The gentleman who was our server has been there for many years. it was nice to see a familiar face again.

I would definitely recommend this place to my family and friends.

excerpts: The BBQ pork was bland.
They forgot an extra rice.
The reason I gave it 2 stars is that the mu she was quite good.
bbq pork.author: Cate R.
bbq pork.review: Not a fan. Wish it was a LOT better because we are tired of always ordering from Lucky River Chinese. The wonton soup had mushy thick tasteless wontons. The BBQ pork was bland. They forgot an extra rice. The reason I gave it 2 stars is that the mu she was quite good.

excerpts: Their BBQ pork chow mein was awful.
The BBQ pork was either not cooked thoroughly or it was some other mystery meat.
bbq pork.author: Jennifer M.
bbq pork.review:
This was my first time ordering from this place. Like so many others, I thought I'd take a chance on this place. Never again. It was the worst Chinese food I have ever had. One of the items I tried was their Crab Rangoon. It had an inedible, bland pasty ball in the middle of the fried wonton that had no crab in it. My whole family had to spit it out. Their BBQ pork chow mein was awful. The BBQ pork was either not cooked thoroughly or it was some other mystery meat. We couldn't eat it. 

Unfortunately for us, it was all bad. I will not be ordering from here ever again.

excerpts: Then tonight I order BBQ pork fried rice, broccoli beef and snow peas and prawns.
I need to tell her she got the order wrong the last time and to please make sure the BBQ pork not the shredded pork gets into the order.
MORE arguing with the customer!
I haven't even finished placing my order.
At that point I should have just hung up
but I had two starving teenagers in the car.
When I arrive Lucinda who is very professional opens my carton of BBQ pork fried rice and apologizes that Christina got it wrong the last time.
She was very king and all smiles which made up for her co-worker who is rude and obviously doesn't like working in this place.
Our food was piping hot and fresh.
Over the years we know the best items to order such as tonight's choices.

bbq pork.author: Elizabeth R.
bbq pork.review: This West Portal staple has been here ever since I can remember growing up in the neighborhood. It's been a great take out choice for the family for years but something's changed. First of all Christina answering the phone when I have called in for take out. Like last week. You simply call to place an order and she hangs up on you. You call back and she hangs up again. The 3rd time she says, "This is a fax line so I can't hear you when you call.." Like, did I do something wrong? What kind of a response is that? Not even, an apology. So snotty and uppity. Then tonight I order BBQ pork fried rice, broccoli beef and snow peas and prawns. I need to tell her she got the order wrong the last time and to please make sure the BBQ pork not the shredded pork gets into the order. MORE arguing with the customer! I haven't even finished placing my order. At that point I should have just hung up but I had two starving teenagers in the car. When I arrive Lucinda who is very professional opens my carton of BBQ pork fried rice and apologizes that Christina got it wrong the last time. She was very king and all smiles which made up for her co-worker who is rude and obviously doesn't like working in this place. Our food was piping hot and fresh. Over the years we know the best items to order such as tonight's choices. I also recommend the Wonton Soup, Pot Stickers and Chow Fun. You also can't go wrong with these.

excerpts: My fav is the Chinese chicken salad, the brown fried rice with chicken and the chicken w/ broccoli!
YUM
chicken salad.author: Krysten K.
chicken salad.review: Seriously THE best Chinese food ever. Every single time we are back in SF we always make sure to get some good food here! Everyone is friendly (especially Bill) & the food is delicious! My fav is the Chinese chicken salad, the brown fried rice with chicken and the chicken w/ broccoli! YUM

excerpts: We shared a hot and sour soup, which was actually fairly good.
Unfortunately the potstickers we ordered we're just okay with the flavor a little bit off
hot and sour soup.author: Bulldog W.
hot and sour soup.review:
After reading the negative reviews we were apprehensive but we decided to give the restaurant try due to the fact that it is still maintaining a 4-star rating. In all honesty I could forgive a lot when a restaurant is cheap. However NTT sports some fairly high prices for Chinese food. 

All things being equal even if the food had been cheaper I would not be returning.

We shared a hot and sour soup, which was actually fairly good. Unfortunately the potstickers we ordered we're just okay with the flavor a little bit off and then the two entrees, lemon chicken and Hunan beef we're really completely off in terms of flavor and the texture was even worse.

I can only speculate that the chef is deviating from normal recipes. Regardless, we will not be returning and I don't recommend that you do either.

On a final note, the only reason why I gave two stars was really the service.

excerpts: I also enjoy the hot and sour soup and the crab rangoon.
The reason why I gave the place also 5 star is the people who work there.
The waitstaff is very friendly and just welcoming.
hot and sour soup.author: Ahline C.
hot and sour soup.review: It's surprising to see New Tsing Tao Restaurant with low ratings. I would recommend weekday lunch because of the lunch specials. Moving from New York my husband and I we're always looking for a good Chinese spot that reminds us of nyc. This place hits the spot and we're beyond happy to find this little gem. The beef broccoli is my favorite it's very flavorful and the portion is huge for the price. I also enjoy the hot and sour soup and the crab rangoon. The reason why I gave the place also 5 star is the people who work there. The waitstaff is very friendly and just welcoming.

excerpts: Everything from veggie potstickers to hot and sour soup was tasty.
The soup was complex with shrimp as well as the usual ingredients.
The wait staff recommend the medium size, which was more that enough for three of us, with almost a full container to take home.
hot and sour soup.author: Drew L.
hot and sour soup.review: This place is unpretentious outside, and the inside is modest as well, but clean and pleasant. The food is wonderful, and the service, attentive.  Everything from veggie potstickers to hot and sour soup was tasty. The soup was complex with shrimp as well as the usual ingredients. The wait staff recommend the medium size, which was more that enough for three of us, with almost a full container to take home. The house fried rice had a good mix of shrimp, chicken and beef.  The only comment on the sizzling shrimp is that it wasn't sizzling - but it was still very hot and did have a nice curry flavor. Just a half-block from the West Portal Muni stop, its well worth checking out. This was our first visit, and we will be going back.

excerpts:
Fried rice (added peas and carrots, just ask), tea, hot and sour soup, salad, and wedge of orange--perfection. 
Beef was perfectly tender and sauce not too salty, hot and sour soup the best I've had, and fried rice like none other, not greasy and freshly made to order.

Beef was perfectly tender and sauce not too salty, hot and sour soup the best I've had, and fried rice like none other, not greasy and freshly made to order.
hot and sour soup.author: Grace C.
hot and sour soup.review:
Omg, why is this place so good! 

Lunch special with beef and broccoli. Fried rice (added peas and carrots, just ask), tea, hot and sour soup, salad, and wedge of orange--perfection. Beef was perfectly tender and sauce not too salty, hot and sour soup the best I've had, and fried rice like none other, not greasy and freshly made to order.

As a Taiwanese immigrant who's parents judge Chinese food all the time because let's be honest, my parents never went to non-Chinese restaurants when we'd go out to eat and Asian parents ARE judgey, I'd take my parents here.

Solid A because we don't give A+'s.

excerpts: The hot and sour soup was superb.
Mongolian beef was good, but lacked flavor in my opinion.
Tried the eggplant with chicken, but spicy style.
Quite delicious.
We'll definitely be back again!
hot and sour soup.author: Song A.
hot and sour soup.review:
Great service and delicious food! The boyfriend and I ordered the mandarin dinner special for 2. The size able portions made it so that we each had dinner and lunch the next day. We were there towards closing time. The waiter was kind enough to accommodate us without rushing us even, though we were the last patrons. 

The hot and sour soup was superb.
Mongolian beef was good, but lacked flavor in my opinion. Tried the eggplant with chicken, but spicy style. Quite delicious. We'll definitely be back again!

excerpts: The hot and sour soup is good too.
hot and sour soup.author: Ems G.
hot and sour soup.review: The guy who's always serving is always friendly... he's the best.  The lunch specials are perfectly portioned and priced, I love the boneless house spicy chicken!!  Parking is usually crappy, but...where isn't parking crappy in San Francisco.  Take out is always fast.  The hot and sour soup is good too.

excerpts: I like to get my takeout here when I'm in the mood for basic fare...hot and sour soup, beef broccoli  and mushu chicken are all excellent.
As someone who has lived in Taipei and Hong Kong, I can tell you that this may not be the best Chinese food around.
But who cares...
It's a neighborhoody family run place that reminds me of the old school Chinese restaurants scattered throughout the US.
Some of the very negative reviews of this place are way off base and downright mean spirited.
Seems like some people have an axe to grind.
Service is always friendly and quick.
hot and sour soup.author: Eric C.
hot and sour soup.review: This place is great for what it does...which is a slightly Americanized but very tasty Chinese food.  I like to get my takeout here when I'm in the mood for basic fare...hot and sour soup, beef broccoli  and mushu chicken are all excellent.  As someone who has lived in Taipei and Hong Kong, I can tell you that this may not be the best Chinese food around. But who cares...It's a neighborhoody family run place that reminds me of the old school Chinese restaurants scattered throughout the US. Some of the very negative reviews of this place are way off base and downright mean spirited. Seems like some people have an axe to grind.  Service is always friendly and quick.

excerpts: Pot stickers, crab Rangoon, hot and sour soup ....
And honey walnut prawns ...
Tonight we also had Mongolian beef ....
You would be hard pressed to find better
hot and sour soup.author: Richard G.
hot and sour soup.review: My go to dishes ... Pot stickers, crab Rangoon, hot and sour soup .... And honey walnut prawns ... Tonight we also had Mongolian beef .... You would be hard pressed to find better

excerpts: Their hot and sour soup is out of this world.
Seriously, it was the only thing that nursed me back to health during a nasty cold.
hot and sour soup.author: Rachel F.
hot and sour soup.review:
YUM. Their hot and sour soup is out of this world. Seriously, it was the only thing that nursed me back to health during a nasty cold. I've tried the both the vegetarian and carnivore options, and you really can't go wrong. 

I've only ordered take-out from this restaurant, but I've been meaning to come and actually have dinner here. They prepare the food so unbelievably fast without sacrificing any taste.

excerpts: Ordered Vegetarian Hot and sour soup.
hot and sour soup.author: Noor K.
hot and sour soup.review:
Ordered Vegetarian Hot and sour soup. 
It was horrible. 

Water with cornstarch, and bamboo shoots, eggs, that's it. 
Woudlnt issue refund, or deliver one with something in it. 

Horrible.

excerpts: The hot and sour soup was solid.
The salad that also came with the lunch was nasty.
Some lettuce with a few slivers of carrot and too much Italian dressing.
Seriously better to serve no salad than serve that.
The food itself was mixed.
Companion got the general tso's chicken (it's not called this) which was not very good at all.
I had fish with vegetables, which was pretty decent, but not great.
hot and sour soup.author: Brian H.
hot and sour soup.review: Stopped in for lunch recently. The food was a mixed bag. The hot and sour soup was solid. The salad that also came with the lunch was nasty. Companion got the general tso's chicken (it's not called this) which was not very good at all. I had fish with vegetables, which was pretty decent, but not great.

excerpts: They have my favorite hot and sour soup, and I also love the mu shu pork.
Staff is super friendly too and willing to accommodate to special diet restrictions when possible
hot and sour soup.author: Jackie K.
hot and sour soup.review: This is one of my go-to Chinese restaurants. They have my favorite hot and sour soup, and I also love the mu shu pork. Staff is super friendly too and willing to accommodate to special diet restrictions when possible

excerpts: The vegetarian Hot and Sour soup is really good, nice and peppery, like old style SF Chinese restaurants used to serve.
The vegetables are always fresh and crispy.
Service is fast and friendly.
One time I got a sorry looking salad with tired old Iceburg lettuce that was turning brownish reddish
and so I mentioned it to the lady working that day.
She took it away instantly, no attitude, and brought a nice fresh looking one.
I like that.
Their Won Ton soup is good too.
I also like that some of the chicken dishes use white meat.
Overall, it is consistently good fast Chinese food with friendly service and a convenient location.
This has become my go-to Chinese restaurant.
hot and sour soup.author: Chanel B.
hot and sour soup.review: I really like this place for lunch or takeout. The vegetarian Hot and Sour soup is really good, nice and peppery, like old style SF Chinese restaurants used to serve. The vegetables are always fresh and crispy. Service is fast and friendly. One time I got a sorry looking salad with tired old Iceburg lettuce that was turning brownish reddish and so I mentioned it to the lady working that day. She took it away instantly, no attitude, and brought a nice fresh looking one. I like that. Their Won Ton soup is good too. I also like that some of the chicken dishes use white meat. Overall, it is consistently good fast Chinese food with friendly service and a convenient location. This has become my go-to Chinese restaurant.

excerpts: I love their hot and sour soup, and they have an online deal where you can get a free chow mein or rice if you order a certain amount.
This is my go to Chinese food place when I want to eat in!
hot and sour soup.author: Lindsey V.
hot and sour soup.review: I have never actually eaten in the restaurant but they have free delivery and they are fast! I love their hot and sour soup, and they have an online deal where you can get a free chow mein or rice if you order a certain amount. This is my go to Chinese food place when I want to eat in!

excerpts: This place has the best hot and sour soup I've ever had in my entire life (from Boston to here)!
The price is the same as anywhere else
but they're soup
is packed with pork and shrimp.
You'll never feel cheated paying close to 9.00 for water and  mushrooms, etc.
they deserve to win the title of best hot and sour soup in the Bay Area.
I love supporting small businesses that serve good food for reasonable prices.

Every time I'm in the bay area I make sure and get me my Tsing Tao fix since I was about eight years old.
Planning on going there again!
hot and sour soup.author: Gabriel G.
hot and sour soup.review: This is hands down my favorite Chinese restaurant in the entire country. Their hot and sour soup is the most wonderful thing ever. Every time I'm in the bay area I make sure and get me my Tsing Tao fix since I was about eight years old. Planning on going there again!

excerpts: The hot and sour soup was sour but not hot.
The only decent dish we got that had some flavor was the bok choy.
I guess this is what I get for not following my own rule:
don't get takeout from a place that never has any customers.
hot and sour soup.author: Carolyn S.
hot and sour soup.review: We've had take out three times from this place.  First time wasn't bad - not exciting, but not bad.  The second time was even less exciting but it wasn't scary.  As soon as I got in the car with the food last night I knew there was trouble.  Bad, bad smell.  The ribs were impossible to eat - really hard, cold and rubbery and they were the source of the bad smell.    The chicken with peanuts was worse than tasteless.  The hot and sour soup was sour but not hot.  The only decent dish we got that had some flavor was the bok choy.   I guess this is what I get for not following my own rule:  don't get takeout from a place that never has any customers.

My boyfriend orders egg rolls at every Asian restaurant
we go to and he says these are the best ones, which says a lot
I totally recommend - you can't beat it!
wonton soup.author: Amanda O.
wonton soup.review: I love this place! I've lived in West Portal for 3 years and food is always amazing and super fresh. I get their wonton soup every time - it is seriously the best!! My boyfriend orders egg rolls at every Asian restaurant we go to and he says these are the best ones, which says a lot  I totally recommend - you can't beat it!

excerpts: The wor wonton soup had no flavor.
The wontons mostly consisted of dough, and what little filling there was lacked flavor.
The broth was disgusting, and the other ingredients were clearly added in layers.
Note to the chef - you may benefit from an advanced cooking technique -
wonton soup.author: David B.
wonton soup.review:
The good:

This restaurant delivers quickly.  Almost impossibly quickly. 

And I think I know why.

The bad:

This was the worst Chinese food I've ever eaten.  And I've eaten Chinese food on the West Coast, the East Coast, many capital cities in Europe.... not to mention Beijing, Shanghai and Hong Kong.  Even my Dad makes better Chinese food than this place, and he is British.  (I don't want to hurt his feelings, but I'm pretty confident he is not active on social media).

The wor wonton soup had no flavor.  The wontons mostly consisted of dough, and what little filling there was lacked flavor.  The broth was disgusting, and the other ingredients were clearly added in layers.  Note to the chef - you may benefit from an advanced cooking technique - it's called stirring.

The pot stickers were nasty.  I imagine that they were they output of a Chopped Junior stylee show, where the chef was challenged to create a dish from actual pot and a couple of sheets of stickers.

After that I kind of gave up, but the combination fried rice was particularly nasty.  Spoiler alert- it's basically a combination of identical looking (I would say tasting, but that would imply flavor) brown meat.  My guess is that it is intended to look like beef, but it doesn't taste like beef.  I know it couldn't have been dog, so I am at a loss.

I will yield my last words to Jason M who reported here on this restaurant five days ago...

"If I am about to die from hunger and this is the only place that serves food, I would rather die than eat their disgusting and filthy good. The food that they serve is horribly disgusting. The food was raw uncooked cold and smelled awful. Avoid at any cost."

I was reluctant to post tonight, in case I was their only customer this evening - but I wanted to make sure to express my opinion in case I don't survive the night.

wonton soup.review: Not a fan. Wish it was a LOT better because we are tired of always ordering from Lucky River Chinese. The wonton soup had mushy thick tasteless wontons. The BBQ pork was bland. They forgot an extra rice. The reason I gave it 2 stars is that the mu she was quite good.

excerpts: Our waiter nicely asked right away if I was allergic to wheat.. he kindly, easily offered wonton soup without the wontons and asked what kind of vegetables I would like to be added.
Delightfully light wonton soup with fresh meats (without the wontons) and fresh not overcooked vegetables.
My husband had the lunch version of pork chops....
wasn't on the lunch menu but
our waiter knew the regular pork chops would be too much for lunch, so they again offered to work off menu to our satisfaction.
Everything was tasty, not over salted, great home-style cooking.
The staff there talked a bit with us about gluten free and other ideas for alternative noodles.
Some restaurants are offended with special diet needs.
We will return soon, looking forward to it!!
Will be able to be clear about more stars when we return for another try.
wonton soup.author: Betsy A.
wonton soup.review:
We were first guided to try New Tsing Tao through YELP reviews. Really love how YELP can help us when we are curious to try a new place to eat when we are scheduled 
for a meeting in a specific neighborhood. That is how we found the wonderful New Tsing Tao. It's been in the W. Portal neighborhood since the early 90's. My first question was if they had rice noodles in their soups. Our waiter nicely asked right away if I was allergic to wheat.. he kindly, easily offered wonton soup without the wontons and asked what kind of vegetables I would like to be added. Delightfully light wonton soup with fresh meats (without the wontons) and fresh not overcooked vegetables. My husband had the lunch version of pork chops....wasn't on the lunch menu but our waiter knew the regular pork chops would be too much for lunch, so they again offered to work off menu to our satisfaction. Everything was tasty, not over salted, great home-style cooking. The staff there talked a bit with us about gluten free and other ideas for alternative noodles. Some restaurants are offended with special diet needs. We will return soon, looking forward to it!! Will be able to be clear about more stars when we return for another try.

wonton soup.review: ordered a few dishes for delivery and in the middle of eating our meal we found tiny  bugs in our wonton soup!! not just ONE, but about  5 that were visible! little nasty bugs...Actually my daughter is the one that saw them! F'n nasty ass food! So we ended up throwing everything away! What a WASTE! When my husband called to let them know, they offered to make a new one, but who the hell wants an f'in new soup with more bugs!! Nasty poop place!!

excerpts: I always get the sizzling rice soup, the vegetables and chicken are always super fresh and cooked just perfectly and the addition of the rice makes it a stand alone meal in itself.
The staff is always welcoming and attentive and parking around the corner is usually very easy.
sizzling rice soup.author: Roger E.
sizzling rice soup.review: Definitely my go-to for well prepared, fresh, and delicious Chinese food.  I always get the sizzling rice soup, the vegetables and chicken are always super fresh and cooked just perfectly and the addition of the rice makes it a stand alone meal in itself.  The staff is always welcoming and attentive and parking around the corner is usually very easy.

excerpts: I highly recommend their Sizzling Rice Soup, Mongolian Beef, Orange Chicken, and Egg Rolls.
sizzling rice soup.author: Jorge R.
sizzling rice soup.review:
I've been going to NTT for several years now and it's been pretty consistent with its quality and pricing -- 4 stars because I'm spoiled with delicious Chinese cuisine in this great city. 

I highly recommend their Sizzling Rice Soup, Mongolian Beef, Orange Chicken, and Egg Rolls. 

The locale is clean - bathroom included - and the staff friendly, accommodating, and thoughtful. 

There's a metered parking in a lot adjacent to the restaurant and all along West Portal Ave, and residential parking along Portola Ave.

There's also a lot to do in the area after your lunch or dinner... perfect for a date or family outing. 

Dinner and a movie?

excerpts: Best sizzling rice soup
I've ever tried - the staff is always friendly and the food is excellent!
I've been trying various Chinese spots in the area and so far this one is my favorite!
sizzling rice soup.author: Christine L.
sizzling rice soup.review: Best sizzling rice soup I've ever tried - the staff is always friendly and the food is excellent! I've been trying various Chinese spots in the area and so far this one is my favorite!

excerpts: hot and sour and egg flower soup are yummy too :)
egg flower soup.author: Nikki W.
egg flower soup.review: this has become my go to for chinese in the city. really friendly fast service if you dine in, and quick delivery(over $19 then it's free). they have an amazing lunch special too. me and my husband love their veggie chow mein and the walnut chicken. hot and sour and egg flower soup are yummy too :)

excerpts: I've recently discovered their Seafood Soup and the broth is heavenly with their always wonderful prawns and even scallops!
Helen who takes our order via phone remembers us and always gives us extra hot oil, sweet and sour sauce and fortune cookies.
Been in for lunch a few times too and the service is super friendly.
Good hot tea also!
seafood soup.author: S. M.
seafood soup.review:
This has been my take-out Chinese food for practically as long as I can remember. It reminds me of being home with my family, excited for when the door bell rang and the delicious aroma filled the house as soon as that paper bag crossed our door.
I pretty much compare all Chinese spots to this place - it is not overly greasy like most Chinese food had, everything is extremely flavorful and cooked to perfection. I've recently discovered their Seafood Soup and the broth is heavenly with their always wonderful prawns and even scallops! 
Helen who takes our order via phone remembers us and always gives us extra hot oil, sweet and sour sauce and fortune cookies. Been in for lunch a few times too and the service is super friendly. Good hot tea also!

excerpts: I was going to give it 4 stars, but then I found a small piece of metal on the beef in my broccoli beef.
Luckily I saw it, although possibly ate one on another piece that I didn't see ‍
broccoli beef.author: Michael H.
broccoli beef.review: As most reviews have stated, customer service is excellent and food is mediocre and cheap. I was going to give it 4 stars, but then I found a small piece of metal on the beef in my broccoli beef. Luckily I saw it, although possibly ate one on another piece that I didn't see ‍

excerpts: Then tonight I order BBQ pork fried rice, broccoli beef and snow peas and prawns.
I need to tell her she got the order wrong the last time and to please make sure the BBQ pork not the shredded pork gets into the order.
MORE arguing with the customer!
I haven't even finished placing my order.
At that point I should have just hung up
but I had two starving teenagers in the car.
When I arrive Lucinda who is very professional opens my carton of BBQ pork fried rice and apologizes that Christina got it wrong the last time.
She was very king and all smiles which made up for her co-worker who is rude and obviously doesn't like working in this place.
Our food was piping hot and fresh.
Over the years we know the best items to order such as tonight's choices.

Over the years we know the best items to order such as tonight's choices.
broccoli beef.author: Elizabeth R.
broccoli beef.review: This West Portal staple has been here ever since I can remember growing up in the neighborhood. It's been a great take out choice for the family for years but something's changed. First of all Christina answering the phone when I have called in for take out. Like last week. You simply call to place an order and she hangs up on you. You call back and she hangs up again. The 3rd time she says, "This is a fax line so I can't hear you when you call.." Like, did I do something wrong? What kind of a response is that? Not even, an apology. So snotty and uppity. Then tonight I order BBQ pork fried rice, broccoli beef and snow peas and prawns. I need to tell her she got the order wrong the last time and to please make sure the BBQ pork not the shredded pork gets into the order. MORE arguing with the customer! I haven't even finished placing my order. At that point I should have just hung up but I had two starving teenagers in the car. When I arrive Lucinda who is very professional opens my carton of BBQ pork fried rice and apologizes that Christina got it wrong the last time. She was very king and all smiles which made up for her co-worker who is rude and obviously doesn't like working in this place. Our food was piping hot and fresh. Over the years we know the best items to order such as tonight's choices. I also recommend the Wonton Soup, Pot Stickers and Chow Fun. You also can't go wrong with these.

excerpts: Sweet and sour chicken, broccoli beef, golden fried chicken appetizer...
I get hungry just writing about it.
broccoli beef.author: Renfield K.
broccoli beef.review: My local takeout place. Awesome friendly staff, delicious food. Sweet and sour chicken, broccoli beef, golden fried chicken appetizer...I get hungry just writing about it.

excerpts: We also had the Broccoli Beef.
Both dishes were great.
Usually when you fry chicken pieces you get the dregs of the chicken.
You know ass meat, gizzards and the back fat with a little meat.
Not here, they were Breast pieces which turned out tender, surprised!
Also when you crispy fry chicken pieces and drown it in sauce it turns the crispy to sog heaven but not here.
It stayed crispy and was very delectable.
The Broccoli Beef was very tender and the Broccoli not over cooked.
Very good and the price was decent averaging $10.00 per dish but the portions were good.
Try it out if you're in the neighborhood.
Right now if I had a choice to wait in line at Sun Tung on Irving or grab a quick seat and a hot meal at the New Tsing Tao.
I choose the latter.
broccoli beef.author: graham c.
broccoli beef.review: Had dinner here last night and it made me ask the question... why not come here more often? We had the spicy crispy chicken which was like Sweet & Sour Chicken except better. You make the determination if you try the dish... We also had the Broccoli Beef. Both dishes were great. Usually when you fry chicken pieces you get the dregs of the chicken. You know ass meat, gizzards and the back fat with a little meat. Not here, they were Breast pieces which turned out tender, surprised! Also when you crispy fry chicken pieces and drown it in sauce it turns the crispy to sog heaven but not here. It stayed crispy and was very delectable. The Broccoli Beef was very tender and the Broccoli not over cooked. Very good and the price was decent averaging $10.00 per dish but the portions were good. Try it out if you're in the neighborhood. Right now if I had a choice to wait in line at Sun Tung on Irving or grab a quick seat and a hot meal at the New Tsing Tao. I choose the latter.

excerpts: and then the two entrees, lemon chicken and Hunan beef we're really completely off in terms of flavor and the texture was even worse.
hunan beef.author: Bulldog W.
hunan beef.review:
After reading the negative reviews we were apprehensive but we decided to give the restaurant try due to the fact that it is still maintaining a 4-star rating. In all honesty I could forgive a lot when a restaurant is cheap. However NTT sports some fairly high prices for Chinese food. 

All things being equal even if the food had been cheaper I would not be returning.

We shared a hot and sour soup, which was actually fairly good. Unfortunately the potstickers we ordered we're just okay with the flavor a little bit off and then the two entrees, lemon chicken and Hunan beef we're really completely off in terms of flavor and the texture was even worse.

I can only speculate that the chef is deviating from normal recipes. Regardless, we will not be returning and I don't recommend that you do either.

On a final note, the only reason why I gave two stars was really the service.

excerpts: We ordered the egg roll, $6.25 (4 pieces cut in 1/2, came with dipping sauce), small hot/sour soup, $6.50 (enough for 3 bowls) - the soups do come in S, M, L sizes; one of the specials of the day - Chinese broccoli & chicken, $9.50; and Sizzling beef, $9.95.
Didn't like the sizzling beef.
It didn't come sizzling either.
sizzling beef.author: Ry T.
sizzling beef.review:
Our neighbors seem to like this place and during a recent conversation, he mentioned how he was going to miss it (they're moving) and liked the egg rolls (vegetarian) and hot & sour soup but skip the pot stickers, he said.
So, we decided to give it a try.  We ordered the egg roll, $6.25 (4 pieces cut in 1/2, came with dipping sauce), small hot/sour soup, $6.50 (enough for 3 bowls) - the soups do come in S, M, L sizes; one of the specials of the day - Chinese broccoli & chicken, $9.50; and Sizzling beef, $9.95.  Tea, rice, fortune cookies/sliced orange came w/the meal too.

I liked the crispy egg rolls, not so much the dipping sauce.  The broccoli/chicken and hot/sour soup were good.  Didn't like the sizzling beef.  It didn't come sizzling either.  It had too much catsup in it and reminded me of tomato beef over rice.  The waiter was very nice and altho' it seemed slow for a Saturday nite, most of the customers there were regulars including a teen who came in by himself for take-out & the staff seemed to know him.  The prices are clearly a lot more than Tsing Tao #3 right on West Portal (no relationship).

excerpts: My friend had the tomato beef plate.
tomato beef.author: Daniel D.
tomato beef.review:
First time visiting this restaurant on February 29, 2016. Clean decor.

Had a delicious spicy chicken lunch plate, includes salad and soup. My friend had the tomato beef plate. Cooked-to-order and hot.

A much better value than the restaurant at the corner 4 doors down.

Will visit again.

excerpts: It had too much catsup in it and reminded me of tomato beef over rice.
The waiter was very nice and altho' it seemed slow for a Saturday nite, most of the customers there were regulars including a teen who came in by himself for take-out & the staff seemed to know him.
The prices are clearly a lot more than Tsing Tao #3 right on West Portal (no relationship).

excerpts: I do pretty much stick to my favorites here - the mongolian prawns are unavoidable.
mongolian prawns.author: Grem W.
mongolian prawns.review:
This place is great. The owners wait the tables and are incredibly nice people. The delivery couldn't be faster.

The food is much more fresh than most chinese, and the won ton soup is the best. I do pretty much stick to my favorites here - the mongolian prawns are unavoidable. The potstickers are excellent, although i miss the chicken ones they used to have.

There definitely isn't a shortage of chinese take out around me, and i've tried a lot of them. But i settled on New Tsing Tao years ago, and i'm always disappointed when i stray.

excerpts: my fav dish is Prawn and vegetable and chicken and green bean or try sizzling prawns!!
sizzling prawns.author: River D.
sizzling prawns.review:
Best Chinese food in the area! This is my favorite restaurant not only because is clean but also because their food is so delicious. Staff is very friendly, WILLIAM is the best! he is quick to take the order and very nice. He already knows what I like to order (:  my fav dish is Prawn and vegetable and chicken and green bean or try sizzling prawns!! 

TOTALLY Recommend this spot.

Iris

excerpts: The spicy dishes were good but not spicy which is why I took off a star; the orange beef was tender with garlic, orange peal, & chili pepper in a wonderful brown sauce but they needed to kick it up with the chili peppers; the same with the sizzling prawns which a couple bites were spicy but the prawns suculent with fresh zuchini, carrots, onions, & green peppers in a brown sauce.
sizzling prawns.author: Brian S.
sizzling prawns.review: Dined here this past Friday for dinner & loved it.  The place is celean with friendly service in a casual atmosphere; serving some of the best Mandarin, Szechwan, & Hunan cuisine.  The pot stickers were probably some of the best we had with thin crispy golden warappers & a wonderful ground pork, cabbage, & ginger filling with a lite broth & perfect with soy vinigre drizzled over them.  The spicy dishes were good but not spicy which is why I took off a star; the orange beef was tender with garlic, orange peal, & chili pepper in a wonderful brown sauce but they needed to kick it up with the chili peppers; the same with the sizzling prawns which a couple bites were spicy but the prawns suculent with fresh zuchini, carrots, onions, & green peppers in a brown sauce.  The prawn chow mein was very flavorful with suculent prawns, fresh vegetables, & wonderfully seasoned cnoodles.  The brown rice was firm not soggy & nutty.  Round it all off with a couple Tsing Taos & you will not be disappointed.  So, for some wonderful Mandarin cuisine & good Szechwan & Hunan cuisine in a clean atmosphere with friendly service, New Tsing Tao cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

excerpts: This is a great little local Chinese restaurant that offers the usual but will cook to order, if asked..try the sizzling prawns (or sizzling anything) prepared by the tireless waiter Bill, right at your table.
It's a neighborhood staple for a satisfying meal, especially  if  you're not quite up or dressed for the more upscale remodeled eateries that have sprung up on West Portal Av
..   Call them from your job downtown and pick up a great meal when you get off the K, L, or M train at the West Portal station!
sizzling prawns.author: Chris O.
sizzling prawns.review: This is a great little local Chinese restaurant that offers the usual but will cook to order, if asked..try the sizzling prawns (or sizzling anything) prepared by the tireless waiter Bill, right at your table.  It's a neighborhood staple for a satisfying meal, especially  if  you're not quite up or dressed for the more upscale remodeled eateries that have sprung up on West Portal Av..   Call them from your job downtown and pick up a great meal when you get off the K, L, or M train at the West Portal station!

excerpts: We ordered Sauteed String Beans.
This dish was absolute perfection.
Great texture, not overcooked.
So tasty.
It was my favorite dish of the night.
You must try it.
sauteed string beans.author: Gigi F.
sauteed string beans.review:
Had dinner here tonight with the fam. Had not eaten here in many years. I wanted my BF and  our daughter to experience this place.

We ordered BBQ Pork wonton soup. It was very good. It tasted the same as I remembered it from all those years ago. 

We also had the Fried Crab Cheese Rangoon. It was good. But, they used to stuff it with a lot more filling before and it was a little more flavorful before as well.  

We ordered Sauteed String Beans. This dish was absolute perfection. Great texture, not overcooked. So tasty. It was my favorite dish of the night. You must try it.  Yumm-O!

We also ordered the BBQ Pork Chow Mein. By this time, I was so full that I only had very, very little of it at the end. I only added a small dash of soy sauce. Even with very little warmth left, it tasted fine.

They brought us very fresh (albeit cold) slices of orange at the end of our meal along with fortune cookies.

The gentleman who was our server has been there for many years. it was nice to see a familiar face again.

I would definitely recommend this place to my family and friends.

excerpts: My colleague raved about the Mongolian Beef (Hot), Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce, House Special Chow Mein, and House Special Fried Rice.
chinese broccoli with oyster sauce.author: A M.
chinese broccoli with oyster sauce.review:
After reading the bad review, I wanted to give the restaurant a chance because my colleague, who ate there 10 days ago with his family, was raving to everyone at work how good the food was, and he mentioned that the customer service was excellent.  My colleague raved about the Mongolian Beef (Hot), Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce, House Special Chow Mein, and House Special Fried Rice.  

So today, I drove all the way up from Belmont and met friends who took BART from the East Bay and then MUNI to West Portal to try the place on Ulloa that my colleague raved about, and ordered what my colleague said to try.  Friends of mine, who came from the East Bay, and myself agree that the food had no taste, bland and very salty.

Only good thing about the restaurant is the customer service.  Wait Staff are very attentive, and came around to see how things are.  When they saw that we did not eat our food, they asked us why and we told them it was very salty and we could not eat it.

It is ranked 2 stars because of the customer service.  If it did not have good customer service, I would have given the rank 1 star.

Friends from East Bay, and I were very disappointed because we have had better Chinese food than this place.  This was our first time going to this restaurant.  Won't go back again.

excerpts: My colleague raved about the Mongolian Beef (Hot), Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce, House Special Chow Mein, and House Special Fried Rice.

excerpts: Vegetable chow mein
A lot of Bok choy
but it was done well.
I've had chow mein with more flavorful noodles but it was still pretty good.
chow mein.author: Shannon C.
chow mein.review:
I ordered from here during the day in the early afternoon for takeout. My friend and I shared it and everything was pretty good. 

Vegetable chow mein
A lot of Bok choy but it was done well. I've had chow mein with more flavorful noodles but it was still pretty good.

Crab Rangoons
I didn't taste really any crab but they were delicious and crisp anyway and that's kind of how I like them.

Sweet and sour chicken
Great. Good flavor, perfectly cooked vegetables and tender chicken. 

Overall it was all really satisfying. Not too expensive. All of that plus a small side of rice was $32. It was ready in 10 min & was hot and fresh when I picked it up. I would absolutely order from here again. Good for a go to Chinese takeout place for a decent price.

excerpts: Our favorite dishes are: Won Ton Soup, Scallops with Black Bean Sauce, Mu Shu Pork!, Mongolian Beef, King Pao Shrimp & Chicken, House Crispy Chow Mein.
We take up the biggest table every other Thursday - don't come that day.
Just kidding - hahaha.
chow mein.author: Stefan O.
chow mein.review: The food and service is excellent. Our favorite dishes are: Won Ton Soup, Scallops with Black Bean Sauce, Mu Shu Pork!, Mongolian Beef, King Pao Shrimp & Chicken, House Crispy Chow Mein. We take up the biggest table every other Thursday - don't come that day. Just kidding - hahaha.

excerpts: Their BBQ pork chow mein was awful.
The BBQ pork was either not cooked thoroughly or it was some other mystery meat.
chow mein.author: Jennifer M.
chow mein.review:
This was my first time ordering from this place. Like so many others, I thought I'd take a chance on this place. Never again. It was the worst Chinese food I have ever had. One of the items I tried was their Crab Rangoon. It had an inedible, bland pasty ball in the middle of the fried wonton that had no crab in it. My whole family had to spit it out. Their BBQ pork chow mein was awful. The BBQ pork was either not cooked thoroughly or it was some other mystery meat. We couldn't eat it. 

Unfortunately for us, it was all bad. I will not be ordering from here ever again.

excerpts: Our entrees were chow mein, which Nora created on her own, with tomato, white meat chicken, and extra sauce.
It was great, and William was happy to accomodate Nora's taste preference.
chow mein.author: Julia D.
chow mein.review:
Nora S's family is basically best friends with William and his sister Helen, the owners, so I came here and was not surprised to have a great meal.  We came on a Friday night around 6:30, were seated immediately, and went on to enjoy 3 excellent dishes.  We started with egg blossom soup--like egg drop but with small piece of tofu, mushroom, and peas.  It was piping hot and had a light and tangy flavor.  Our entrees were chow mein, which Nora created on her own, with tomato, white meat chicken, and extra sauce.  It was great, and William was happy to accomodate Nora's taste preference.  The moo shu chicken was delicious and perfect.  

I told Nora that I felt like we were eating at William and Helen's home.  I would definitely come back.  It was a very small crowd eating in (most people were picking up take out) which made the restaurant quieter and more mellow.  Definitely somewhere to hit up at West Portal if you're looking for some affordable Chinese cuisine.

excerpts: I love their hot and sour soup, and they have an online deal where you can get a free chow mein or rice if you order a certain amount.
This is my go to Chinese food place when I want to eat in!
chow mein.author: Lindsey V.
chow mein.review: I have never actually eaten in the restaurant but they have free delivery and they are fast! I love their hot and sour soup, and they have an online deal where you can get a free chow mein or rice if you order a certain amount. This is my go to Chinese food place when I want to eat in!

excerpts: me and my husband love their veggie chow mein and the walnut chicken.
chow mein.author: Nikki W.
chow mein.review: this has become my go to for chinese in the city. really friendly fast service if you dine in, and quick delivery(over $19 then it's free). they have an amazing lunch special too. me and my husband love their veggie chow mein and the walnut chicken. hot and sour and egg flower soup are yummy too :)

excerpts: The prawn chow mein was very flavorful with suculent prawns, fresh vegetables, & wonderfully seasoned cnoodles.
The brown rice was firm not soggy & nutty.
Round it all off with a couple Tsing Taos & you will not be disappointed.
So, for some wonderful Mandarin cuisine & good Szechwan & Hunan cuisine in a clean atmosphere with friendly service, New Tsing Tao cannot be beat.
Keep up the good work guys.

The prawn chow mein was very flavorful with suculent prawns, fresh vegetables, & wonderfully seasoned cnoodles.  The brown rice was firm not soggy & nutty.  Round it all off with a couple Tsing Taos & you will not be disappointed.  So, for some wonderful Mandarin cuisine & good Szechwan & Hunan cuisine in a clean atmosphere with friendly service, New Tsing Tao cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

The Lo Mein was forgettable.
We also had General Tsou's Chicken.
The sauce was light, but bland.
The chicken pieces were smaller and I found two bones!
I wouldn't recommend it.

The Lo Mein was forgettable.  We also had General Tsou's Chicken.  The sauce was light, but bland.  The chicken pieces were smaller and I found two bones!  I wouldn't recommend it.

prawn chow mein.review: Dined here this past Friday for dinner & loved it.  The place is celean with friendly service in a casual atmosphere; serving some of the best Mandarin, Szechwan, & Hunan cuisine.  The pot stickers were probably some of the best we had with thin crispy golden warappers & a wonderful ground pork, cabbage, & ginger filling with a lite broth & perfect with soy vinigre drizzled over them.  The spicy dishes were good but not spicy which is why I took off a star; the orange beef was tender with garlic, orange peal, & chili pepper in a wonderful brown sauce but they needed to kick it up with the chili peppers; the same with the sizzling prawns which a couple bites were spicy but the prawns suculent with fresh zuchini, carrots, onions, & green peppers in a brown sauce.  The prawn chow mein was very flavorful with suculent prawns, fresh vegetables, & wonderfully seasoned cnoodles.  The brown rice was firm not soggy & nutty.  Round it all off with a couple Tsing Taos & you will not be disappointed.  So, for some wonderful Mandarin cuisine & good Szechwan & Hunan cuisine in a clean atmosphere with friendly service, New Tsing Tao cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

excerpts: We also ordered the BBQ Pork Chow Mein.
By this time, I was so full that I only had very, very little of it at the end.
I only added a small dash of soy sauce.
bbq pork chow mein.author: Gigi F.
bbq pork chow mein.review:
Had dinner here tonight with the fam. Had not eaten here in many years. I wanted my BF and  our daughter to experience this place.

We ordered BBQ Pork wonton soup. It was very good. It tasted the same as I remembered it from all those years ago. 

We also had the Fried Crab Cheese Rangoon. It was good. But, they used to stuff it with a lot more filling before and it was a little more flavorful before as well.  

We ordered Sauteed String Beans. This dish was absolute perfection. Great texture, not overcooked. So tasty. It was my favorite dish of the night. You must try it.  Yumm-O!

We also ordered the BBQ Pork Chow Mein. By this time, I was so full that I only had very, very little of it at the end. I only added a small dash of soy sauce. Even with very little warmth left, it tasted fine.

They brought us very fresh (albeit cold) slices of orange at the end of our meal along with fortune cookies.

The gentleman who was our server has been there for many years. it was nice to see a familiar face again.

I would definitely recommend this place to my family and friends.

excerpts: Their BBQ pork chow mein was awful.
The BBQ pork was either not cooked thoroughly or it was some other mystery meat.
bbq pork chow mein.author: Jennifer M.
bbq pork chow mein.review:
This was my first time ordering from this place. Like so many others, I thought I'd take a chance on this place. Never again. It was the worst Chinese food I have ever had. One of the items I tried was their Crab Rangoon. It had an inedible, bland pasty ball in the middle of the fried wonton that had no crab in it. My whole family had to spit it out. Their BBQ pork chow mein was awful. The BBQ pork was either not cooked thoroughly or it was some other mystery meat. We couldn't eat it. 

Unfortunately for us, it was all bad. I will not be ordering from here ever again.

excerpts: My colleague raved about the Mongolian Beef (Hot), Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce, House Special Chow Mein, and House Special Fried Rice.
house special fried rice.author: A M.
house special fried rice.review:
After reading the bad review, I wanted to give the restaurant a chance because my colleague, who ate there 10 days ago with his family, was raving to everyone at work how good the food was, and he mentioned that the customer service was excellent.  My colleague raved about the Mongolian Beef (Hot), Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce, House Special Chow Mein, and House Special Fried Rice.  

So today, I drove all the way up from Belmont and met friends who took BART from the East Bay and then MUNI to West Portal to try the place on Ulloa that my colleague raved about, and ordered what my colleague said to try.  Friends of mine, who came from the East Bay, and myself agree that the food had no taste, bland and very salty.

Only good thing about the restaurant is the customer service.  Wait Staff are very attentive, and came around to see how things are.  When they saw that we did not eat our food, they asked us why and we told them it was very salty and we could not eat it.

It is ranked 2 stars because of the customer service.  If it did not have good customer service, I would have given the rank 1 star.

Friends from East Bay, and I were very disappointed because we have had better Chinese food than this place.  This was our first time going to this restaurant.  Won't go back again.

excerpts: The one thing that, I liked very much was their House Special Fried Rice and it tasted really good
it was one of my favorite item on their menu.
I also have to say that their bathrooms are pretty clean as well!!!
house special fried rice.author: William B.
house special fried rice.review: I have been to New Tsing Tao Restaurant several times for lunch in the weekday. The one thing that, I liked very much was their House Special Fried Rice and it tasted really good it was one of my favorite item on their menu. I also have to say that their bathrooms are pretty clean as well!!!

excerpts: The house fried rice had a good mix of shrimp, chicken and beef.
The only comment on the sizzling shrimp is that it wasn't sizzling - but it was still very hot and did have a nice curry flavor.
Just a half-block from the West Portal Muni stop, its well worth checking out.
This was our first visit, and we will be going back.
fried rice.author: Drew L.
fried rice.review: This place is unpretentious outside, and the inside is modest as well, but clean and pleasant. The food is wonderful, and the service, attentive.  Everything from veggie potstickers to hot and sour soup was tasty. The soup was complex with shrimp as well as the usual ingredients. The wait staff recommend the medium size, which was more that enough for three of us, with almost a full container to take home. The house fried rice had a good mix of shrimp, chicken and beef.  The only comment on the sizzling shrimp is that it wasn't sizzling - but it was still very hot and did have a nice curry flavor. Just a half-block from the West Portal Muni stop, its well worth checking out. This was our first visit, and we will be going back.

excerpts:
Fried rice (added peas and carrots, just ask), tea, hot and sour soup, salad, and wedge of orange--perfection. 
Beef was perfectly tender and sauce not too salty, hot and sour soup the best I've had, and fried rice like none other, not greasy and freshly made to order.

Beef was perfectly tender and sauce not too salty, hot and sour soup the best I've had, and fried rice like none other, not greasy and freshly made to order.
fried rice.author: Grace C.
fried rice.review:
Omg, why is this place so good! 

Lunch special with beef and broccoli. Fried rice (added peas and carrots, just ask), tea, hot and sour soup, salad, and wedge of orange--perfection. Beef was perfectly tender and sauce not too salty, hot and sour soup the best I've had, and fried rice like none other, not greasy and freshly made to order.

As a Taiwanese immigrant who's parents judge Chinese food all the time because let's be honest, my parents never went to non-Chinese restaurants when we'd go out to eat and Asian parents ARE judgey, I'd take my parents here.

Solid A because we don't give A+'s.

excerpts: After that I kind of gave up, but the combination fried rice was particularly nasty.
Spoiler alert-
it's basically a combination of identical looking (I would say tasting, but that would imply flavor) brown meat.
My guess is that it is intended to look like beef, but it doesn't taste like beef.
fried rice.author: David B.
fried rice.review:
The good:

This restaurant delivers quickly.  Almost impossibly quickly. 

And I think I know why.

The bad:

This was the worst Chinese food I've ever eaten.  And I've eaten Chinese food on the West Coast, the East Coast, many capital cities in Europe.... not to mention Beijing, Shanghai and Hong Kong.  Even my Dad makes better Chinese food than this place, and he is British.  (I don't want to hurt his feelings, but I'm pretty confident he is not active on social media).

The wor wonton soup had no flavor.  The wontons mostly consisted of dough, and what little filling there was lacked flavor.  The broth was disgusting, and the other ingredients were clearly added in layers.  Note to the chef - you may benefit from an advanced cooking technique - it's called stirring.

The pot stickers were nasty.  I imagine that they were they output of a Chopped Junior stylee show, where the chef was challenged to create a dish from actual pot and a couple of sheets of stickers.

After that I kind of gave up, but the combination fried rice was particularly nasty.  Spoiler alert- it's basically a combination of identical looking (I would say tasting, but that would imply flavor) brown meat.  My guess is that it is intended to look like beef, but it doesn't taste like beef.  I know it couldn't have been dog, so I am at a loss.

I will yield my last words to Jason M who reported here on this restaurant five days ago...

"If I am about to die from hunger and this is the only place that serves food, I would rather die than eat their disgusting and filthy good. The food that they serve is horribly disgusting. The food was raw uncooked cold and smelled awful. Avoid at any cost."

I was reluctant to post tonight, in case I was their only customer this evening - but I wanted to make sure to express my opinion in case I don't survive the night.

excerpts: I had the egg-fried rice, and they didn't overcook the eggs like every.single.place does.
fried rice.author: Shannon O.
fried rice.review:
This place is pretty yummy and the service is good. Wasn't busy at all when we came, which is a plus. 

Simple dishes (at least what we ordered), which worked great for my picky husband. I had the egg-fried rice, and they didn't overcook the eggs like every.single.place does. And while it was pretty tasty, the rice itself was a just meh.

Not bad, but not a "come to West Portal for this Chinese food" type of place.

excerpts: My wife and I had pork fried rice, broccoli with tofu, and chicken with snow peas.
It was all tasty, and there was enough of the tofu and chicken left for dinner (with fresh rice) the next night.
fried rice.author: Harold W.
fried rice.review: The service is good and friendly, and the decor is pleasant.  The prices are very reasonable for San Francisco. My wife and I had pork fried rice, broccoli with tofu, and chicken with snow peas. It was all tasty, and there was enough of the tofu and chicken left for dinner (with fresh rice) the next night.

excerpts: My fav is the Chinese chicken salad, the brown fried rice with chicken and the chicken w/ broccoli!
YUM
fried rice.author: Krysten K.
fried rice.review: Seriously THE best Chinese food ever. Every single time we are back in SF we always make sure to get some good food here! Everyone is friendly (especially Bill) & the food is delicious! My fav is the Chinese chicken salad, the brown fried rice with chicken and the chicken w/ broccoli! YUM

I need to tell her she got the order wrong the last time and to please make sure the BBQ pork not the shredded pork gets into the order.
MORE arguing with the customer!
I haven't even finished placing my order.

Chicken

fried rice.author: Natasha S.
fried rice.review:
This was incredibly good! I was out in Richmond at a friend's and didn't feel like going out, so we decided to get delivery. So, please note that this review is only applicable for their delivery service and won't touch on the actual restaurant.

They were very polite and professional on the phone, asking me my phone number, address, what I wanted, and made sure to repeat all of the information back to me to verify that it was correct. I chose to pay in cash, but Credit Card is also accepted. The wait time would be about 40-50 minutes, but with the amount of food I ordered I wasn't too surprised.

~Vegetarian Spring Rolls
~Combination Fried Rice
~Chicken Won Ton Soup (other flavors available)
~Lemon Chicken
~Beef w/ Broc.

Everything was delivered right when they said it would be, and came steaming hot. All of the "wet" dishes came individually wrapped and sealed in a plastic bag in addition to the boxes, which was good since some of the sauce from the lemon chicken had leaked from the corners. 

The food itself was excellent and all incredibly well-priced. The only down side is they didn't include any chopsticks/plastic utensils, but this wasn't a real problem since I had my own.

I would definitely order from them again!

kung pao chicken.review: I was honestly a little disappointed to see that the Korean BBQ spot ive been wanting to try was replaced with another chinese spot. But seeing as i work up the block i grabbed a menu anyways. Super cheap lunch specials! ok so i was all...I must try this place. and yum is all i have to say. yum! ive only tried teh lunch specials but i keep goin back for em! $4.85 for a huge serving of kung pao chicken and rice? psh ill take thanks. so far reh sesame chicken is my fav. hmmm i think i might order that today.  i will be aregular for sure!

excerpts: I had walnut prawns, kung pao chicken, and brown rice to go.
the food was so so, not particularly good, not particularly bad.
maybe it would have been better eaten there.
kung pao chicken.author: John R.
kung pao chicken.review:
I was a little disappointed with my first experience.  I had walnut prawns, kung pao chicken, and brown rice to go.  the food was so so, not particularly good, not particularly bad.  maybe it would have been better eaten there.  but at about $25 for that meal, definitely too expensive.

I was also surprised to read the comments about the friendly service.  Both the woman who took my order and the waiter were on the surly side.   Who knows, maybe they were having a bad night...or they just didn't like me.  (No, it couldn't have been that, it must have been a bad night!)

excerpts:
Sweet and sour chicken
Great.
sweet and sour chicken.author: Shannon C.
sweet and sour chicken.review:
I ordered from here during the day in the early afternoon for takeout. My friend and I shared it and everything was pretty good. 

Vegetable chow mein
A lot of Bok choy but it was done well. I've had chow mein with more flavorful noodles but it was still pretty good.

Crab Rangoons
I didn't taste really any crab but they were delicious and crisp anyway and that's kind of how I like them.

Sweet and sour chicken
Great. Good flavor, perfectly cooked vegetables and tender chicken. 

Overall it was all really satisfying. Not too expensive. All of that plus a small side of rice was $32. It was ready in 10 min & was hot and fresh when I picked it up. I would absolutely order from here again. Good for a go to Chinese takeout place for a decent price.

excerpts: Sweet and sour chicken, broccoli beef, golden fried chicken appetizer...
I get hungry just writing about it.
sweet and sour chicken.author: Renfield K.
sweet and sour chicken.review: My local takeout place. Awesome friendly staff, delicious food. Sweet and sour chicken, broccoli beef, golden fried chicken appetizer...I get hungry just writing about it.

excerpts: The Lemon Chicken was overly breaded and sweet, with the lemon itself being almost undetectable.
The crab Rangoon was basically just deep fried cream cheese.
The pork was overly fatty, and the veggie pot stickers were tasteless.
To top it off, the vinegar sauce had no bite.
The only decent condiment was the chili oil.
lemon chicken.author: Nathan P.
lemon chicken.review:
This might not be a totally fair review because 1)we consciously ordered Americanized Chinese rather than actual Mandarin dishes because that's what we were in the mood for and 2)I'm grading on my hardest "San Francisco" scale, which is about a star harder than average for me. Even on that basis it was pretty disappointing, though. The Lemon Chicken was overly breaded and sweet, with the lemon itself being almost undetectable. The crab Rangoon was basically just deep fried cream cheese. The pork was overly fatty, and the veggie pot stickers were tasteless. To top it off, the vinegar sauce had no bite. The only decent condiment was the chili oil. The food was also lukewarm by the time it was delivered, so that didn't help anything.

Granted, it's no worse than I've had in plenty of places around the US, but in SF this is pretty sad.

Oh Wok Shop Cafe, I so miss you.

excerpts: and then the two entrees, lemon chicken and Hunan beef we're really completely off in terms of flavor and the texture was even worse.
lemon chicken.author: Bulldog W.
lemon chicken.review:
After reading the negative reviews we were apprehensive but we decided to give the restaurant try due to the fact that it is still maintaining a 4-star rating. In all honesty I could forgive a lot when a restaurant is cheap. However NTT sports some fairly high prices for Chinese food. 

All things being equal even if the food had been cheaper I would not be returning.

We shared a hot and sour soup, which was actually fairly good. Unfortunately the potstickers we ordered we're just okay with the flavor a little bit off and then the two entrees, lemon chicken and Hunan beef we're really completely off in terms of flavor and the texture was even worse.

I can only speculate that the chef is deviating from normal recipes. Regardless, we will not be returning and I don't recommend that you do either.

On a final note, the only reason why I gave two stars was really the service.

excerpts: We ordered delivery from here for dinner - egg rolls, house chow mien with chicken, beef, and shrimp, and lemon chicken.
All were very tasty, classic chinese food - just what we were looking for!
It's nothing outstanding, but even the leftovers kept us satisfied.
And quick delivery was a huge plus!
lemon chicken.author: Danielle L.
lemon chicken.review: We ordered delivery from here for dinner - egg rolls, house chow mien with chicken, beef, and shrimp, and lemon chicken.  All were very tasty, classic chinese food - just what we were looking for!  It's nothing outstanding, but even the leftovers kept us satisfied.  And quick delivery was a huge plus!

excerpts: We got Lemon Chicken, Mongolian Beef, Sweet and Sour Pork and the chicken wings.
All delicious.
lemon chicken.author: Mona R.
lemon chicken.review: Best tasting Chinese food deliver I've had in the area. We got Lemon Chicken, Mongolian Beef, Sweet and Sour Pork and the chicken wings. All delicious.

excerpts: All of the "wet" dishes came individually wrapped and sealed in a plastic bag in addition to the boxes, which was good since some of the sauce from the lemon chicken had leaked from the corners.
lemon chicken.author: Natasha S.
lemon chicken.review:
This was incredibly good! I was out in Richmond at a friend's and didn't feel like going out, so we decided to get delivery. So, please note that this review is only applicable for their delivery service and won't touch on the actual restaurant.

They were very polite and professional on the phone, asking me my phone number, address, what I wanted, and made sure to repeat all of the information back to me to verify that it was correct. I chose to pay in cash, but Credit Card is also accepted. The wait time would be about 40-50 minutes, but with the amount of food I ordered I wasn't too surprised.

~Vegetarian Spring Rolls
~Combination Fried Rice
~Chicken Won Ton Soup (other flavors available)
~Lemon Chicken
~Beef w/ Broc.

Everything was delivered right when they said it would be, and came steaming hot. All of the "wet" dishes came individually wrapped and sealed in a plastic bag in addition to the boxes, which was good since some of the sauce from the lemon chicken had leaked from the corners. 

The food itself was excellent and all incredibly well-priced. The only down side is they didn't include any chopsticks/plastic utensils, but this wasn't a real problem since I had my own.

I would definitely order from them again!

excerpts: New favorite dish as of this evening: Green Bean Chicken.
It is so delicious!!!!
green bean chicken.author: Nora S.
green bean chicken.review:
My family has been coming here for years and some dishes we don't even have to order anymore because William and Helen already know that is what we want.  New favorite dish as of this evening: Green Bean Chicken.  It is so delicious!!!!  Their Won Ton Soup is also top notch (much like their service!).

New Tsing Tao is the best!!!

excerpts: I was unimpressed by my green bean chicken.
I spent a lil over 10 bucks, and can't say it was worth every dollar.
Very friendly owner though.
Short wait time for take out orders.
green bean chicken.author: Thomas L.
green bean chicken.review: If you've got the Chinese-American taste buds going on, then this is the place for you. I was unimpressed by my green bean chicken. I spent a lil over 10 bucks, and can't say it was worth every dollar. Very friendly owner though. Short wait time for take out orders.

excerpts: My friend and I shared the Orange Beef and the Garlic Chicken.
The beef was tasty, but the chicken didn't have much flavor, let alone garlic flavor.
I don't get to West Portal often, but I might give it another try when I'm out there.
garlic chicken.author: Paul L.
garlic chicken.review: My friend and I shared the Orange Beef and the Garlic Chicken. The beef was tasty, but the chicken didn't have much flavor, let alone garlic flavor. I don't get to West Portal often, but I might give it another try when I'm out there.

excerpts: The lunch specials are perfectly portioned and priced, I love the boneless house spicy chicken!!
Parking is usually crappy, but...
where isn't parking crappy in San Francisco.
Take out is always fast.
boneless house spicy chicken.author: Ems G.
boneless house spicy chicken.review: The guy who's always serving is always friendly... he's the best.  The lunch specials are perfectly portioned and priced, I love the boneless house spicy chicken!!  Parking is usually crappy, but...where isn't parking crappy in San Francisco.  Take out is always fast.  The hot and sour soup is good too.
